snippet: A son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as a spokesman for Al Qaeda will appear in court Friday to face terrorism charges that could bring a life sentence.
abstract: Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as a spokesman for Al Qaeda, will appear in New York courtroom to face terrorism charges that could bring a life sentence; Justice Department officials describe him as a propagandist who they believe has not had an operational role in Al Qaeda for years and is not believed to have participated in Sept 11 attacks; he will be charged with conspiracy to kill Americans.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Scott Shane contributed reporting from Washington, and Benjamin Weiser from New York.

lead_paragraph: A son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as a spokesman for Al Qaeda will appear in court Friday to face terrorism charges that could bring a life sentence.

headline.seo: Bin Laden’s Son-in-Law Is Held in New York
headline.main: Bin Laden Relative With Qaeda Past to Have New York Trial
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Figure Is Held to Face New York Trial
